title: How to Print on an Envelope in Word on Windows & Mac

steps.title: Click the Mailings tab.
steps.content: Click the Mailings tab. You'll find this tab at the top of Microsoft Word. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the Envelopes button.
steps.content: Click the Envelopes button. It's in the "Create" section of the toolbar, which is on the far-left side of the window. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Enter a delivery address.
steps.content: Enter a delivery address. Click the text box below the "Delivery address" heading, then type the delivery address you want to appear on the envelope. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Enter a return address.
steps.content: Enter a return address. Type the return address as you'd like it to appear in the "Return address" box.

steps.title: Click Options….
steps.content: Click Options… . It's near the bottom of the window. A new window will open.

steps.title: Click the Envelope Options tab.
steps.content: Click the Envelope Options tab. This option is at the top of the window.

steps.title: Select an envelope size.
steps.content: Select an envelope size. Select the exact size of your envelope from the "Envelope size" drop-down menu. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If none of the choices are the size of your envelope, select Custom size at the bottom of the list, and then enter the dimensions of your envelope.

steps.title: Click the Printing Options tab.
steps.content: Click the Printing Options tab. It's at the top of the window.

steps.title: Select an envelope feed format.
steps.content: Select an envelope feed format. Click one of the visual representations of an envelope feeding into a printer. This is how you'll need to insert the envelope into the printer. [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source The "feed method" options determine whether the long or short end of the envelope will be fed into the printer, as well as where on the feed tray (left, middle, or right) you'll be inserting the envelope. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you feed the envelope short edge first, you may need to rotate the envelope to prevent the text from appearing upside-down. The "face" is the side of the envelope that contains the address information.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . It's at the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Insert the envelope into your printer.
steps.content: Insert the envelope into your printer. Make sure that you do this according to your chosen feed format. If you're not sure how to insert an envelope into your printer, check your printer's documentation.

steps.title: Click Print.
steps.content: Click Print . It's in the bottom-left corner of the Envelopes window. Your envelope will begin printing. [7] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you encounter issues while printing the envelope, try resetting the feed format to the Word default. To save the envelope for future use, click the Add to Document button, then save the document. The envelope will be saved on page one of the document. To print the envelope, insert an envelope into your printer, open your document, then print it from the Envelope menu in the "Mailings" tab.

steps.title: Click the Mailings tab.
steps.content: Click the Mailings tab. It's at the top of the Word window. [8] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Envelopes.
steps.content: Click Envelopes . This option is on the far-left side of the Mailings toolbar. [9] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Enter a delivery address.
steps.content: Enter a delivery address. Click the text box below the "Delivery address" heading, then type the delivery address you want to appear on the envelope. [10] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Enter a return address.
steps.content: Enter a return address. Type the return address as you'd like it to appear in the "Return address" box.

steps.title: Click the "Use settings from your printer" radio button.
steps.content: Click the "Use settings from your printer" radio button. This will ensure that your printer's ideal settings are used. Skip this step if the button is already selected.

steps.title: Click Page Setup….
steps.content: Click Page Setup… . It's on the right side of the window. A new window will open.

steps.title: Select your envelope size from the "Paper Size" menu.
steps.content: Select your envelope size from the "Paper Size" menu. Choose the exact size of your envelope from this menu. If you don't have multiple sizes and only see Envelope , choose that option. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . It's at the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This button is at the bottom of the "Envelope" window. Now you'll see a preview of your envelope.

steps.title: Review the envelope's layout.
steps.content: Review the envelope's layout. You can make any last-minute changes to your envelope's size and shape here.

steps.title: Adjust the Page Setup to reflect your envelope size.
steps.content: Adjust the Page Setup to reflect your envelope size. Here's how: Click the File menu. Click Page Setup . Select the size of your envelope, and make sure Landscape orientation is selected. Click OK .

steps.title: Place the envelope in your printer.
steps.content: Place the envelope in your printer. If you're not sure how to insert an envelope into your printer, check your printer's documentation.

steps.title: Print the envelope.
steps.content: Print the envelope. Click the File menu item in the upper-left side of the screen, then click Print... in the resulting drop-down menu. Choose your printer and any other preferences, and then Print the envelope. [12] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If the print preview is blank and/or the envelope prints blank, click the Word menu, select Preferences , click Print , and check the box next to "Drawing objects." To save the envelope for future use, click the Add to Document button, then save the document. The envelope will be saved on page one of the document. To print the envelope, insert an envelope into your printer, open your document, then print it from the Envelope menu in the "Mailings" tab.

steps.title: What do I do if I don't have a "Mailings" tab?
steps.content: What do I do if I don't have a "Mailings" tab? Click File > Options > Customize Ribbon . Under the "Customize the Ribbon" heading, scroll down and check the "Mailings" option. Then, click OK to save your choice. [13] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Why am I getting the error "The number must be between 1 and 31"?
steps.content: Why am I getting the error "The number must be between 1 and 31"? You are likely getting this error because Word is trying to print your document as labels instead of an envelope. To fix it, ensure "envelope" is chosen in the pop-up box after you click Envelope. If it's still giving you trouble, try clicking Labels in the "Mailings" tab, then click the Envelope tab in the pop-up. [14] X Research source
